events.name: Full Stack Foundation Showcase - StackUp
events.description:
Looking for engineers, startups and/or parnters in crime? Join us at the NUS-ISS StackUp Full Stack Foundation Showcase!
 
The newest batch of Full Stack Foundation will be demonstrating the products they have been toiling over the past 40 days. Come see the transformation from tech novice to tech entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs as a result of the close guidance and mentorship of the startup-based lecturers and community members.
 
Products on display range widely due to the diverse background of the cohort so there’s something for everyone– look below for some details.
 
Also, don’t miss our alumni and community showcases as well.  We are pleased to present the under-the-radar e-scooter project by our lecturer and alumni combo Pylon City, our alumni’s rising star and app-extraordinaire CutQ, and the company by our pioneer batch of lecturers-Temasys.

events.name: Introduction to Kubernetes Workshop
events.description:
Hello Everyone This will be the inaugural Kubernetes User Group Meetup in Singapore. This will be a workshop orientated talk. To people who would like to follow along here is the link to the instructions : https://gist.github.com/jamesbuckett/17fe25caa2b85886c78597310bab74bd Due to the high number of people wanting to attend I am asking kublets to fill in this form to confirm that they will be attending. </a><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/c0JK0dUp8yil3QRf1">https://goo.gl/forms/c0JK0dUp8yil3QRf1 We will be installing Kubernetes on Digital Ocean using kubeadm. kubeadm is a new tool that is part of the Kubernetes distribution as of 1.4.0 which helps you to easily install and set up a Kubernetes cluster. Then we will deploy a microservices application onto Kubernetes called socks-shop. All the steps will be pre-published on GitHub so that attendees can follow along during the session so please bring your laptops if you want to follow along. I will be using Digital Ocean so please have your accounts setup and have SSH keys loaded. Here is a referral link to get $10 in credit on Digital Ocean: https://m.do.co/c/ac62c560d54a This workshop will allow attendees to understand Kubernetes, Micro-services Applications and have their own cluster to play in their own time. The workshop will be hosted at Honestbee. "Honestbee is a marketplace for services in Asia, providing fast and on-demand concierge and delivery services for all your lifestyle needs. We are always looking for people who are growth-focused, ready to make a change and contribute to the expansion of the platform.  Join us to help tackle challenges of eCommerce and logistics while empowering the communities by providing positive social and financial impact to the businesses and people we touch" 

Roles here: https://honestbee.sg/en/careers  Check out the latest media coverage here: http://edition.cnn.com/videos/world/2017/03/29/asean-honestbee.cnn

events.name: April Meetup
events.description: Our second meetup of the year is coming up! Programme • Clojurescript workflow with devcards   Prerequisite: better to know clojurescript/figwheel 1st Speaker: Liu Hao Hao Liu works as a Clojure developer, with his full enthusiasm to FP, he has more than 2 years as a Clojurian and is enthusiastic about the language. He has previously given a talk about Implement SPA with ClojureScript, Reagent/re-frame during Clojure Meetup #9. • Building a reactive web frontend with Hoplon  2nd Speaker: Melvin Zhang Melvin is an avid programmer who enjoys designing and implementing novelalgorithms.  As the lead architect of Cosmiqo, Melvin is in charge of developing its sensor data aggregation and analytics platform. In his sparetime, Melvin works on the AI for Magarena, an open source card game project. Melvin has previously given this talk during Clojure Meetup #6. Target Attendees: This program is designed for Clojure beginners, but all are welcome if you are interested on this program.  Purpose of this April Meetup: Besides knowledge sharing the above mentioned 2 topics, we want to spend some time to understand more from all Clojurians their expectation about Clojure Community in the future and from there we will be able to organize more meetups regularly to aid different needs and finally build up a more efficient and effective Clojure Community in Singapore.  Please bring your own laptop with Clojure and editor installed. Location Flybot Pte. Ltd. 1 Commonwealth Lane #08-14, One CommonwealthSingapore 149544 P.S. Refreshment will be provided.
events.location: Flybot Pte. Ltd, 1 Commonwealth Lane, Singapore

events.name: Singapore PHP + Magento Combined Meetup
events.description:
Date: Tuesday, 18 April 2017
Time: 7:30pm - 9:30pm
Venue: Red Dot Ventures Pte Ltd
Address: 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #04-04, Singapore 139955

Speakers:
========
1) Magento: What's New, 2017 Edition
Speaker: Ben Marks

Coming off of several product announcements at this year's Imagine conference, there's a lot to talk about. Magento Evangelist Ben Marks is in town to talk about these announcements as well as new initiatives which are underway. 

Ben is a voting representative in the PHP FIG and has more than 10 years in open source commerce working with some of the biggest brands. He serves as an educator and mentor for Magento, having trained hundreds of developers directly as well as thousands of others through the Magento U Fundamentals series. He's always excited to meet other developers to talk about and learn from the challenges and successes of building successful commercial sites with PHP.

2) 4 levels of IT Architecture
Speaker: Shurn Heng

Original Article: https://shurn.me/blog/2017-03-09/the-4-levels-of-it-architecture

Why does knowing the 4 levels of IT Architecture matter?

If you're someone not from IT background, how would this benefit you? Knowing how IT systems are planned and constructed helps you to understand the development process and the cost justification. Being able to understand your fellow IT collegues will certainly make a better team.

If you're someone already in the IT field, you probably already know about architectures. Knowing the 4 levels of architecture allows you to be an effective communicator, if your team/organisation still has trouble understanding one another. To speak in a team, requires common understanding of terms of words.

===================================

Venue Sponsor: Red Dot Ventures
Food Sponsor: TribeHired
events.location: Red Dot Ventures Pte Ltd, Launchpad@One-North, Singapore 139955
